poem:
**Kingmaker of the Mersey**  

In Liverpool's embrace, the needle spins,  
Silk threads of fate through vinyl's thin skin,  
Brian's hand, the quiet semaphore,  
Guiding four lads to the world's open door.  
In whispers of Beatle boots and crowded halls,  
He inked their dreams, caught before the falls.  
Kingmaker unseen, in echoes he calls.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Midas Man review – Jacob Fortune-Lloyd is heartfelt as Beatles’ kingmaker British actor Jacob Fortune-Lloyd stars as the Beatles’ manager Brian Epstein in this uneven but well-meaning biopic. The screenplay by Brigit Grant and Jonathan Wakeham weaves the story in and around the two or three main facets of Epstein that are always invoked in every potted bio: he was instrumental in the Beatles’ huge international success (Paul McCartney would later describe him as “the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
